etymologies: mid 18th century. From Hindi mor-paṅkhī, lit. ‘resembling a peacock's wing’ from mor-paṅkh peacock's wing (from mor peacock (from Sanskrit mayūra) + -paṅkh wing (from Sanskrit pakṣa)) + -ī, feminine suffix forming adjectives

definitions: In India: a kind of pleasure boat used on the River Ganges, built in the shape of a peacock.
